DOCNAME: NASSAU VERZEKERING MAATSCHAPPIJ N.V. v. THE NETHERLANDS
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company , ORG , are a limited company ( naamloze vennootschap ) incorporated under GPE law with its offices in GPE . Their business is insurance . The applicant company were represented before ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant company , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP The limited partnership ( commanditaire vennootschap ) H. was a firm of insurance brokers . The applicant company insured H. against professional liability .

CARDINAL . One of the clients served by ORG was the limited liability company ( besloten vennootschap ) NORP Among the insurance contracts negotiated for NORP by PERSON was a fire insurance policy with a different insurance company ( not the applicant ) covering a warehouse belonging to NORP
CARDINAL . A dispute arose between ORG and NORP after the warehouse was damaged by fire . It emerged that the warehouse was underinsured , allegedly as a result of ORG ’s negligence .

CARDINAL . R. sued PERSON for the difference between the insurance payout and the actual damage before ORG ( rechtbank ) of PERSON . On DATE that court ordered H. to pay to NORP a total sum of CARDINAL in damages , plus interest and costs .
CARDINAL . NORP The time - limit for lodging an appeal with ORG ( gerechtshof ) expired on DATE .
CARDINAL . The appeal summons ( dagvaarding ) was served on NORP on DATE , that is DATE . The applicant company state that this resulted from an oversight on the part of the bailiff ( deurwaarder ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE gave judgment rejecting ORG ’s appeal as out of time .
CARDINAL . H. lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( PERSON ) , which confirmed ORG judgment on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant company paid the sums awarded by ORG to NORP
CARDINAL . On DATE and the applicant company signed a deed of assignment ( akte van cessie ) containing the following clauses :

“ CARDINAL . The parties [ i.e. H. and the applicant company ] take the view that DATE since it has now been established in law that H. ’s appeal is inadmissible DATE right of access to a tribunal , enshrined in LAW , has been violated . H. thus has a claim against the GPE based on violation of LAW . This claim will be realised by bringing proceedings against ORG in ORG on the ground of violation of LAW .

CARDINAL . H. is prepared to assign the above - mentioned claim against ORG to [ the applicant company ] for the purpose of the intended proceedings . [ The applicant company ] are prepared to accept this assignment . ”
